title: Yes, it really is THAT amazing.
text:
My pictures do not do it justice but my memories will stay with me forever.
We had a guide - I like to know all the details and history - and would recommend that for you if you like history and explanations of the remarkable water system.
Well worth it to hike further to The Monastery and then further from their to Suicide View. Spectacular views and once you get to the monastery, the crowd is noticeably thinner.
We packed in a light lunch from items from the breakfast buffet at our hotel. There are two buffet restaurants on the site but we didn’t need that much to eat and they were around 20 JD.
I tried my best to resist the hawkers. Once you say no, they leave you alone. They were not aggressive which can worry N Americans.

title: Great view nice place
text:
Located about 10 minutes from the visitors centre at Petra, the Marriott is the one hotel that had a shuttle that runs on the hour from the site. That was very helpful as we did an extended hike.
The rooms are clean and up-to-date; the hotel is quite new.
Good food and a great view.
We were especially impressed with the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff they went out of their way to accommodate us.
I also visited the spa. After a day of hiking, the hammam and a tranquility massage were just right.

title: Relax and float!
text:
We had two nights at the Marriott at the end of a two week Middle East tour.
The food was delicious with a wide variety. We ate breakfast and dinner.
The rooms were immaculate.
The pools were clean and inviting with lots of seating.
The big attraction, of course, was floating in the sea. An experience not to be missed.
After many hotels through three countries, the staff at this Marriott were exceptionally helpful, friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us.
Jordan was incredibly safe and the people throughout were friendly. Do not miss an opportunity to visit this remarkable country.

title: Interesting drive, HOT springs!
text:
We hired a car for 135JD but there were a number of tourists in rental cars and the highway was not crowded and was easy to navigate.
The drive from the Marriott was fascinating. As soon as you turn off the highway, you understand why The Martian was filmed in Jordan! The only sound was the bells on the goats that scramble over the rocks and silt.
The springs are extremely hot and unlike the ones we’ve visited in N America, they are waterfalls! Very neat. While we were there, the main waterfall was diverted for shoring up and expanding. It will be amazing.

title: Amazing
text: Well worth the visiting time. Statues and smaller items found on the site. The display of pottery jugs at the entrance are amazing. The gift shops are reasonably priced and the one on the main floor has unique jewelry.

title: Great staff and great location
text: We stayed four nights. Staff went out of their way to make suggestions and help. Rooms were very clean. Really appreciated the complementary bottle of wine. Breakfast was great to start the day. In an fabulous location!!!

title: Very interesting
text: We’re not religious and wondered what touring around Tel Aviv would be like. Areas such as Jaffa have a historical significance as well as interesting architecture. Great walk!

title: Wonderful massage!
text: I was staying in the hotel and wanted to use the steam room so booked a short massage. I extended it when I arrived and am I ever glad I did! Exceptional massage- the best I’ve had in ages! The sauna and steam room are very clean and well maintained. Just right after a long day of touring around.

title: You know you’ve got to go!
text:
Unintentionally went a half hour before closing on the only free day we had.
Note: it closes at 5 on Sundays.
Still, an amazing site and a must do, no matter the time limit.

title: Excellent guide, excellent experience
text: Jimmy was exceptional! Vast knowledge of the expanse of Greek and Athenian history, great delivery and pacing. Accommodated us a last minute additions. A must-do in Athens!

title: Cool ambiance, delicious food
text: What a great place! It came highly recommended by our tour guide and the food was delicious. The service was confused but they were pretty busy so that happens. Prices were reasonable and the pineapple chicken and mango chicken were great, as was the avocado and papaya appetizer. All seven in our party were very happy with the variety of dishes they had.

title: Excellent choice!
text: Right on the Main Street by the railway tracks, this is a restaurant not to be missed. The food is creative, delicious and beautifully presented. We were with a group of 12 and the food came out at the same time, every course was delicious and the waiter was well versed about the ingredients and preparation. A lovely place with excellent food.

title: Trendy yet thoughtful boutique hotel
text: What a lovely oasis in the centre of the town. Modern, environmentally conscious with classy touches such as different inspiring quotations in each room, lovely toiletries and tea/coffee/biscuits available all day. The restaurant was exceptional for supper: elegant meals prepared with fresh ingredients (the lamb shanks and inspired appetizers were divine). The staff is helpful, friendly and fluent in a variety of languages (in my case, with English). Highly recommend.

title: Excellent!
text: Found on Trip Advisor and Otto’s lived up to the reviews! Five of us went (one man, four women) and all of us came out relaxed, refreshed and recovered from our hike to the Sun Gate! We were able to get in right away, good ambiance and skilled massage therapists. All of us had the Inca massage package (foot soak and a lengthy full body massage with all techniques including hot stones). Lovely!Gracias Otto’s

title: Absolutely lovely
text:
What a wonderful hotel! Two short blocks away from the city walls and those blocks are lined with beautiful Georgian and Victorian houses so it’s a nice walk.
The staff were very welcoming and friendly. The breakfast was delicious with lots of choices. But it’s the atmosphere (a former orphanage!) and the beautifully sumptuous rooms (outstandingly comfortable beds!) that make this a highly recommended place to stay!

title: Pay to go up the tower!
text: We love a great cathedral and Yorkminster is that! The beautiful stained glass windows, effigies and stonework are outstanding. This is a functioning cathedral so be mindful of the service times. The chapter house is breathtaking. The guided tour was very interesting - well worth the time to hear the details of the masonry. And go up that tower! The climb itself is very interesting and the views are unparalleled.

title: Delicious
text: Want to think your in a 1920’s English period piece (think of James Herriot‘ strops into town). What a lovely tea room. Beautiful china and silverware, very friendly and attentive staff and not-to-be-missed, absolutely spectacular cakes and sweet delights. The four of us had different items and we visited twice — and every bite was delicious!

title: Not to be missed
text: My friend and I ended up here after discovering the more commercial Chocolate Story was closed for the day. A young man at the tourist info centre across the road pointed it out to us. We just happened to turn up in time for a tasting. This is well worth the price (I think it was £6? Can’t remember the exact cost). Not only was it a fascinating and informative experience but we were allowed to try any of the buttons or truffles from the expected (peppermint) to the exotic (blue cheese? Delicious!) we were even treated to tastes of the single source bars that had hints of the crops that grew near the cocoa plant. A hidden gem and I can’t recommend it highly enough(and their chocolate too!).

title: Beautiful anytime of the year!
text: The Muttart is a wonderful space for couples, families or groups. Beautiful plants in four different greenhouse pyramids, the staff does a remarkable job creating events (ex orchid display) and decorations (ex Christmas). A break for winter but also a treat in the summer as the grounds are very beautiful too.

title: The perfect Christmas office gift
text:
The creative minds at Jacek create two special treats I’ve enjoyed at Christmas. The first is their Advent calendar: a different chocolate treat every day from Dec 1 to Christmas Day. These are for sophisticated adult palates. Mmmmm!
The second is a small sleeve of special chocolates prices under $20. An indulgent, special Christmas gift I got for each of the office staff. Great price for something really special.

title: What a treat!
text: First, what a cool idea to have a Steve Mcqueen themed hotel. But the theme is not kitschy- it’s subtle and cool. And there’s quirky touches throughout (the recorded voice on the elevator, the window warnings...). Sure the rooms are great, the beds are comfortable and the location is perfect (near all the trendy shopping and lovely restaurants) but don’t come for those things: come for the absolutely fabulous customer service. We do a lot of touring and this is by far one of the most exceptional places for helpful, thoughtful staff. From the lovely young man who arranged for hotel pick up for our bus tour to the other wonderful young man who gave my husband the gourmet doughnut when we were late coming back and the case had been cleaned out. And the helpful list with great descriptions of places to eat, shop and drink — perfect!

title: Anticlimactic
text: First, the book itself and the library are lovely. They are not to be missed if you are a historian, bibliophile or educator. Too bad there wasn’t better organization or tours to move people through and emphasize the significance of both and to point out the unique features of the library. I booked what was supposed to be a tour but wasn’t. It was entry fee and a free-for-all of pushy people butting in around the case. There was no sense of organization. I saw a sign that an audio tour was not available for another few weeks. Hopeful that will make this a more interactive and informative tour.
place: The Book of Kells and the Old Library Exhibition

title: I don’t like beer ... but this I liked!
text: What an amazing tour through production, advertising and tasting of Guinness stout. Very cleverly designed, well-organized and informative. I had never tried Guinness so was unsure if I would enjoy but the friendly, lively atmosphere and very engaging staff made this a great experience

title: Too far, by far!
text:
This review is for visitors who are tourists without cars. On the map, it show the tram stop as very close. Do not be deceived - that stop is a 20 minute walk up and over a major motorway. When you’re dragging your luggage, it’s quite the hike.
Also, as you take the tram from central Dublin, and it starts into the car sales lots and industrial sites, you realize this is not a walking area/neighbourhood.
There were very few rooms available in Dublin for the three nights we needed but as tourists, we would have been better off paying the higher prices to be better located and able to walk in the city.
The rooms are clean but there is no control over the temperature or airflow in the room so it’s stuffy. The front desk was very nice and brought a fan. Again, not a tourist hotel so no suggestions of places to eat, sights to see from the hotel. Could be because it’s in an industrial area.

title: Lovely!
text: Lovely surprise right on the hop on/off route and free entry with hop on/off ticket. A people’s museum, full of fascinating bits and pieces donated to the library, our guide Romeo was entertaining and extremely knowledgeable. You’ve got to love a place that has a U2 room, a delivery list from the Magdalene Laundries and a photo of Christie Brown all in one place! The temporary installation was about women in Dublin - again, very thoughtful as well as thought provoking.

title: Fascinating - not to be missed!!
text:
Warning: book on line- this site lets people in only on their tours and they sell out!
Tremendously informative displays about Irish resistance over the years (including the Finians in N America), lots of information about prison life and design, and a historically important site. Whether you’re a fan of architecture, history or penal codes this is a great site to see. Very informative guide focused on the 1916 uprising. The oldest part of the prison is interesting but that sweeping Victorian staircase is reminiscent of Shawshank Redemption and quite amazing.

title: Absolutely wonderful
text: Moe was knowledgeable, friendly and showed us the important sights on both sides of the Peace Wall. I like to think I’m well read but he had insights and took us places I had not heard of. We even popped into the Sinn Fien office. This is a MUST DO when visiting Belfast.

title: Don’t miss it!
text: What a great museum. Thoughtful, interesting and interactive. Loved the recreated cabins for all three classes. Thought I knew all there was to know but came away with a deeper understanding not only of the Titanic but the ships, shipbuilding and Belfast too.

title: Absolutely fabulous!!!
text: Unbelievable!! Wonderful food, wonderful service. The tasting menu was amazing. Wonderful, unique food combinations— things I have never tried - put together in delicious combinations. I appreciated one server’s suggestion: try each bit separately and then combine them in different combinations. Each mouthful was delicious and different!!

title: Giant’s Causeway
text: A quick trip to Belfast and we wanted to see a bit of the countryside. Perfect tour for this. Very reasonably priced for what you get (a full day of touring, knowledgeable guide). They “picked us up “ at our hotel which involved one guide walking us over to the general pick up a few blocks away, which was perfectly fine (we felt dumb not realizing it was so close!). The Game of Throne sites were a nice add on. We’re not obsessive fans but liked the show so thought we had enough time at each one and plenty of time at the causeway.

title: Wonderful
text: A remarkable outdoor museum that began in the late 1800s when the king moved 5 old, traditional buildings to illustrate the best of Norwegian everyday life. The stave church is remarkable. Also the interpreters throughout the site are very informative. And there's fresh lefse!

title: Amazing
text: Small but very impressive. Three ships that were excavated from different burial sites, along with all the items found on board. A must see for Viking and history buffs.

title: Beautiful hotel, great location
text:
Beautiful hotel, great location.
We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly. The complimentary drink was perfect after a day of sightseeing. The spa was tremendous. I had a foot massage -- very relaxing in a nice atmosphere. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of Eastern and western foods.

title: Cultural event
text:
I enjoyed the puppet show but I like cultural events and music. My husband, who does not particularly enjoy such events, was underwhelmed.
Let's look at it from my perspective:
Wonderful musicians open the show. Very skilled, traditional music, traditional instruments. Lovely!
The puppet show was mesmerizing. Traditional stories that while there was no translation of the parts with dialogue, I found I could follow the stories. With the ten or so traditional tales, they're short enough so I could follow along without too much confusion.
The theatre is very conveniently located for tourists-- across the street from Hoan Kiem Lake and near the Old Quarter.

title: Fascinating history
text: Very well done. Offers a deeper understanding of the French occupation and the Viet resistance. Includes information about women political prisoners and honours the freedom fighters. Parts are difficult to view, such as the guillotine or the reports written so matter-of-factually but well worth the experience to gain new insights.

title: Dreadful
text: A flavourless burger with a stale bun but the most troubling part was the patty was raw in the middle. No server came by (all the ordering is done on iPads) so no recourse. Absolutely horrible.

title: Spectacular
text: This is the most visited tourist attraction in both Brazil and Argentina. It is also one of the seven natural wonders of the modern world. And it lives up to its billing!! Beautiful, awe inspiring - this has it all Visit both sides if you can. Don't feed or touch the cuati - raccoon-like creatures. They look cute but are wild and can hurt you.

title: Amazing.
text:
A phenomenal environmentally friendly lodge. Gourmet food too! Excellent guides, unique trails and an opportunity to be present in the rainforest.
Bring bug spray, wear long pants and long sleeves. Be prepared to be dazzled!!

title: Excellent location
text: A basic hotel but a great staff, very good included breakfast and wonderful location at a reasonable price. We were also very pleased with the front desk staff. Fluent in English and very helpful. Again, the location is in Centro, within walking of a number of attractions and public transport.

title: Exquisite
text: A lovely former sheep farm, beautiful rooms. Boutique hotel with charm and interest. Check out the 19C wool baler in the lobby, the environmentally better toiletries and the daily gaucho herding sheep. Lovely spot, quiet about two blocks off Main Street.

title: Breathtaking
text: Come to see the glacier but appreciate the carefully designed catwalk that provides amazing views of Perdito Morales glacier. Highly recommend taking a boat ride that will take you 300m from the back face of the glacier. Not to be missed.

title: Lammmmb
text: If you enjoy lamb, do not miss this grill restaurant. Extremely popular, reservations are a must. Lamb is roasted gaucho-style: split and spread eagle around a blazing fire. Delicious warm buns and breads to start. Huge portions!

title: Deliciosa!
text: Wonderful pasta! Restaurant is packed but we did not need reservations as we were able to get a table for 6 people. Creative sauces, delicate homemade pasta, wonderful bread, extensive wine list. Reasonably priced for a tourist town. Friendly wait staff.

title: Don't miss it!
text: There are numerous chocolate shops in the town. This one has a lovely cafeteria in the back with delicious hot chocolate, served with a chocolate treat and glass of water. Friends also tried the ice cream and highly recommend it! Bon appetit!

title: Start of something interesting
text: Centre of a lovely tourist area/ski resort region. The statue of the general on the horse is particularly interesting as it commemorates the genocide of the local indigenous peoples (the Mapuche). As such, there is interesting graffiti and political protests. Great to see symbols of repression reclaimed by the people!

title: Clean, quiet!
text: Beautiful views of the lake. The spa is very good- reasonably price, very skilled staff, clean. Bring your phrasebook- not a lot of English is spoken and the spa menu is only in Spanish. It is a 45 walk to the village square.

title: Delicious!
text: We shared the Ementhal fondue, the grilled trout and the breaded cutlet (traditional Argentina family dish). The service was very attentive, helpful and friendly. The grilled trout was amazing. The fondue came with bread cubes, apples, tiny sausages, ham, tomatoes and carrots. Excellent variety. Extensive wine list

title: Always interesting and exciting
text: There is always something to do at the science centre! Their permanent exhibits are fascinating for adults and kids and there is a special area for young kids to explore and learn. Butt better yet are the travelling science shows: Potter World, Indiana Jones, Star Wars etc. All explore science so it's fascinating for fans and families.

title: Exceptional BBQ - just like Southern US
text: From the smoky aroma that wafts through the door to the homemade BBQ sauces, this is an authentic, delicious locally-owned operation. We have eaten in and had take out. Amazing- not to be missed. The brisket is cooked to perfection. Mmmmmm

title: Doesn't disappoint!!
text: I have heard of Duchess for a few years but was never in that part of town. We made a special trip there on Saturday and , boy! was it EVER worth it. We tried scones (blueberry/lemon and choc/orange), macarons (rose and lemon ) , macaron cake(coconut, raspberry and white chocolate filling) croissants (cheese and cheese and leek). Absolutely everything was absolutely delicious. As in Europe, the treats come in individual and larger sizes.

title: Great food , great price
text: Very tasty! Serving staff were friendly and very efficient. Food was fresh and ready very quickly. We had vermicelli bowls (one pork, one lemongrass beef). Definitely recommend!

title: Clean and great location
text: Breakfast (cereals, muffins, toast etc) was fresh and good (also included!). Basic room but it was clean. Nice staff. Best of all, right by a beautiful extensive walking trail that's right on the Sheep River. Recommended.

title: Lives up to the rave reviews!
text: We made a special trip to find the store and were not disappointed. Delicious doughnuts with the taste and texture of homemade and with clever twists. We loved the traditional jelly but the maple bacon is decadently wonderful!

title: Very funny!
text: What a great show! One man, a few graphics but lots of laughs. Added bonus: learn how to pronounce the name of that darned volcano!
place: How to Become Icelandic in 60 Minutes

title: Beautiful!
text: What a tremendous space. Well worth the look around inside. Wish we had been there for a concert. The gift store has many beautiful items but is expensive, possibly because of the proximity to cruise ships' dock.
place: Harpa Reykjavik Concert Hall and Conference Centre

title: Great price!
text: We booked this at the last minute because a food tour fell through. They guarantee you'll see puffins, probably because puffins return to their nesting sites and stay from May until the end of August. I liked that we didn't disturb the birds as we stayed on the boat

title: Well worth the ticket!
text: Visiting inside the church is free. We were lucky to catch the church organist playing a selection of hymns. The acoustics in the church are amazing and the enormous pipes fill the space with sound. Buy the 6kroner ticket at the church office to take the elevator to the top of the spire. Beautiful views of the city even on a overcast day.

title: Thoughtful
text: A small museum but with artifacts from Iceland's history, including the Viking era. Lovely coffee shop in the basement with homemade treats. The Icelandic layer cake was excellent.

title: Good Viking info
text: The remains of a Viking longhouse and some excellent slides on the genome and language of Iceland. Original medieval manuscripts too but you have to pay extra to view them. Having seen more extensive collections in Italy, England and France I didn't think these were worth the extra fee.

title: Perfect coffee, perfect setting
text: The cafe is in an old bank, offering a quiet back room in what was once the vault. Fresh, locally sourced food and delicious coffees/lattes etc. Friendly service. Great local coffee spot. Live music some evenings.
